citations.narrative:
The facility has not updated their acquisition and disposition records since the 2022 calendar year. There were no
acquisition records for two cows, and no disposition records available for six goats and six sheep.
Acquisition and disposition records, including offspring born at the facility, are necessary to accurately track and identify
animals being used in regulated activities, as well as aid in the detection of movement of animals upon relocation to a new
site. The facility shall make, keep, and maintain records of acquisition/disposition of all animals that fully and correctly
disclose the required information.
Correct by January 19, 2024.

One pasture housing one dromedary camel and four cows lacked enough shelter to accommodate all the animals
contained within it. The pasture itself offered two different shelter structures: one semi-circle tin covering and another tall
wooden structure consisting only of vertical wooden beams, a partial roof covering, and no sides. The tin structure was
too small for all of the animals to comfortable rest under it to provide protection from weather extremes and conditions
during the winter season in this region. Additionally, the tall wooden structure did not provide any opportunity for
protection from the weather elements.
Inadequate protection from inclement weather can inhibit an animal’s ability to thermoregulate in cold weather, prolong
discomfort, and increase exposure times in extreme temperatures and elements. All animals must be provided with
shelter to afford protection and prevent discomfort from the extremes of the local climate.
Correct by January 19, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative and licensee.
